column5: Well Cal and I got out today for some smallie fishing on the north end of Simcoe.  They were on today, we got them on everything from jerkbaits, to spinnerbaits, to tubes and dropshots.  Even got some on my new prototype bait, you'll see it when it's ready.  We caught about 15 fish today, about 19 pounds for a tournament, not overly big for Simcoe but respectable.  Even got a n ice pike, which I havent caught to many of outside of Cook's Bay.  Threw some tourney shirts on for pictures, but it was not an actual tournament, just figured the pics would look more professional haha.  Notice the same name on both shirts haha, i might have to photoshop those later.    Cal with his spinnerbait pike.    A nice dropshot fish    Our four biggest fish of the day, all in the 4 lbs class.  Hope you enjoyed, keep readin'
Good going Steve. Had my thoughts about going up there.
That's a very nice Pike!!!... and the Smallies are ok i guess.  Thanks for posting the Pike pic!!!!!!!!!
thanks guys, the lake keeps pumpin oiut big smallies, I love it!
Nicely done. Gotta love simcoe smallies!
Nice smallies!!  Can't wait to get out there for some of those fatties.
oh i do love the simcoe smallies, despite the warm temps they just keep putting on their "winter coat"
Nice batch of fat smallies there and a really nice pike also!
nice fish man... can't wait to hook into a few!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Nice work yet again!  Did you win the tourney??? LOL j/k.  Your reports are always great to read...always some great pics.
Thanks CCMT I try to keep them interesting, otherwise why post? haha  I'm doing Chinook egg collection tomorrow with Fleming College and the MNR, I should have some good pics from that.
